title: Nothing great
review_text:
This beach is just next to the Jetty. It is littered with Plastic. Nothing great about this place. 
Government and local people need to keep this clean if they want to attract tourists.

title: Kid Friendly with Very Little to no Waves
review_text: This is an excellent clear water beach with a levelled sea bed for almost 80-100mtrs. i.e. the height of water from beach till about a 100mtrs is the same depending on the tide. Also the waves are very gentle or non-existent. This makes it uniquely kid friendly beach and we saw a lot of little kids having a gala time jumping and splashing in the water. The place is perfect to laze around. There are also a variety of water sports activity on offer here, however we didn't opt for it. A must visit place if you're at Andamans.

title: Small Beach less no of water sports activities available
review_text: The beach looks fine but does not offer much of water sports activities available. There are quite no of petty shops where you can do shopping. The prices are better when compared to sagarika emporium.

title: Beach for fun and frolic
review_text: The beach though a little crowded is kept very neat and clean. Its well known for its water sports and is total paisa vasool.

title: A Place Which Take The Blues Away
review_text: Undoubtedly Neil Island is one of the most beautiful islands in Andaman. Just about an hour’s ferry ride from Havelock island, it’s a must see in the Andaman travellers’ itinerary. As soon as one nears the jetty the aquamarine colours of the sea water with an ultra blue sky soothes the senses. Just immediately after reaching Neil Island we treated ourselves with fresh tender coconut water. From there we went to Bharatpur Beach, about 15 minutes drive. The place is comparable to Mauritius as far as the colour of the sea and transparent water with coral are considered. The beach is clean, the sand is while and soft – the horizon is a magnificent culmination of various shades of blue, playing with soft white clouds. An awesome place for landscape photography to bring out the ultra wide angle lenses. I took snaps to my heart’s content with my Tokina 11-16mm. The beach is very safe for bathing. However, the seabed is full or coral which makes it difficult to walk on the rough surface. There are beautiful sculptural coral lying everywhere in the beach but as per laws of the land one cannot collect them and leave Andaman. title: Good for a swim
review_text:
A very calm water beach. You can swim here without much efforts. 
The beach is pretty unique as it has water on the same level that is until the knees for a very long stretch. 
Extremely transparent water like most of the beaches in Andaman.

title: Awesome
review_text:
Must look at the natural beauty of A&N islands. 
Food is excellent, beaches are beautiful, mesmerizing....

title: Excellent beach
review_text: Clean water, clean sand, calm place, walk on sand, take bath in water, eat snacks, take photos and enjoy as much as possible.

liked: the crystal clear water, cleanliness, surrounding,water sports. 
didnt like : sea bed was quite rocky make sure you wear sandals to avoid cuts

title: good for glass bottom boats and snorkling

review_text: When we went here, the place was very crowded. The boats dock right at the beach and so you cannot play much in the water. We went on the glass-bottom boat but I guess you will get a better experience in your scuba diving or snorkeling trip.

title: Awesome Sunset
review_text: This rocky beach is not fit for a bath or a dip, but the sunset is just awesome. Sit by the beach waiting for sunset, grab a dabh (coconut), enjoy a hot maggie and spend your evening by the sun

title: Bharatpur Beach
review_text: The only beach in Neil Island where you can enjoy bathing in the ocean water. Changing room with water available. The ocean is deep here and corals less prominent. You can also enjoy a number of activities like viewing corals in glass boat, snorkeling, scuba diving, speedboat, etc. You can spend around two hours here. The shops lining the beach sell curios at the cheapest price in all of Andaman. So don’t forget to do your shopping here. If you are not interested in water sport you can still visit the beach to enjoy the scenery.

title: Lakshmanpur Beach Neil Island
review_text: Another beach that showcases the unique corals of Neil island. A quiet beach ideal to sit for an hour enjoying the refreshing sea breeze. The view of the ocean as it crashes on the rock frothing into bubbles is really charming. But the reason this beach pulls crowd is because of its splendid sunset point. The viewers are left gaping at the sight of the sun turning the ocean blood red and finally plunging into it. Must not miss this.

title: best and busiest beach @neil island

title: Nice beach
review_text: This beach is good for going some water activities. We have gone for snorkeling, glass bottom ride to watch the corals, reefs. Water is greenish .Good for photography.

title: Will not feel great after visiting Laxmanpur and Havelock
review_text: Here the beach is average. People mostly visit this place for glass bottom boating, sea biking, etc.

title: Exotic Neil
review_text: Great Place.....went there for snorkeling, lovely view in the morning hours. Lot of live corals at a walking distance into the waters, clear water, can view lot of aquatic live. The beach is beautiful and photogenic. Next to the jetty

title: Beautiful - best coral/fish viewing
review_text: This is a heavenly beach and considered to be an excellent place for coral viewing - better than North Bay. We opted for Glass Bottom boat ride and definitely this was excellent - not to miss ! We viewed several unimaginable colours of fishes in plenty amongst amazing corals. It was a totally splendid experience to view and out of the world. Moreover, the beach had a stretch of water of 2-3 feet for more than a km with very less waves in white sand!!! What else does one need (especially without knowing swimming :)) !!!!

title: Beautiful Beach
review_text: The beach is beautiful and location pristine as the beaches in the area are being away from hustle and bustle of the general people. Though more primitive you can have great beach outing. The facilities are non existent as its a small place with limited people going to the island

title: Bharatpur beach - overhyped and too commercial
review_text:
Bharatpur beach is just next to the jetty at Neil island. There one can do activities like snorkeling and lots of people will be willing to take to to some distance into the sea for a handsome amount of money. I personally did not like the attitude of the people there as they were taking people for a ride , charging a hefty 400-500 rs for snorkeling and that just just about 10-15 mts from the beach. 
I asked if I could get snorkeling masks for rent and for that too they were asking 300-400 rs for half a day whereas one could get it for 100rs for a full day at other places on the island. 
For people who know how to snorkel I would not recommend this place. More

title: Snorkelling, a must try.
review_text: The beach you see on your left as you arrive at Neil islands is Bharatpur Beach. It's one of the places where one can do snorkelling but beware. There are some local men who charge Rs 400 per person for about 45 mins of snorkelling but we were hushed up within 30 mins. The equipment they use is substandard and safety is a concern. Highly recommend to go with someone like Dive India for a wholesome snorkelling experience. It makes the whole difference.

title: One of the best Island in Neil Island
review_text: I visited there on 28th November 2013. I feel it is one of the best beach of Neil Island. Went there in the afternoon, had a wonderful time in speed boat riding and the best part of it was snorkeling. It is really a good place for coral view with lots of colourful fishes moving around. During low tide you can enjoy swimming near the beach. And don't forget to carry your clothes as you cannot resist yourself seeing the crystal clear blue water which will drive you towards the sea enjoying a pleasant sea bath for hours.

title: Lovely beach for water sports or simply relax..
review_text:
Located next to the Neil Island Jetty, this beach is an ideal spot for tourist checking out of their hotels and resorts, and spending some idle time till the arrival of the cruise in the evening. 

We had to check out of our resort at 11.00 a.m. on 6th December, 2013 and the cruise was scheduled to depart from Neil Island at 4.45 p.m. The question was how to spend the time till 4.00 p.m. The best option available to us was to check out of the resort, keep our luggage at the resort, go to Bharatpur beach spend some 2 hours or so at the beach, return to the resort, have lunch, relax for some time and then move on to the jetty. 
It was during this 2 hours we could indulge in water sport activities like Glass Bottom Boat ride to see the corals, do snorkeling and speed boat ride, change the dress, have coconut water, do some shopping for coral items, and then moved on to the resort for lunch. 

The beach side is filled with broken sea shells which makes it difficult to approach the water bare foot. 
But sitting on the beach side on the wooden benches and feeling the cool breeze was a relaxing experience. 

Glass boat, snorkeling and speed boat cost Rs.600/- per head at present at Bharatpur beach More

title: Fun and frolic
review_text: Bharatpur beach is near the jetty but to think that it is polluted by the onslaught of tourists would be doing the unimaginable. The beach is pristine in spite of many glass bottom boats, water skis and sofa-ride boats plying and it is the only beach in Neil where you can see people bathing. Even we did too, and will never forget the exhilarating experience.

title: Picturesque beach
review_text: Green water...an excellent beach just beside the jetty. During low tides you will find a small patch of sand about 300 metres into the sea, where you can walk down and enjoy. One tip: if you are planning to go for the half-day tour to the Elephanta Beach of Havelock Beach (you must), then skip the water activities here. At least we did not find much corals (10-15%) compared to what we saw at Elephanta Beach. BUt great place to have fun and be amazed at the green sea.

title: coral reef
review_text: Wait for the low tide and discover coral reef appearing from the bottom of the ocean, it almost connects Neil to Havelock!
